page.title: 04OAK TREES IN SHERWOOD
page.content: {Sherwood Forest}is a{Site of {Special Scientific Interest}because of the oak and other trees.The oldest oaks are 400-600 years old,others, replacing fellings,are a 130-200 years old.Another group is 80-100 years in age and the latest group of seedlings are a result of the{myxomatosis} outbreak destroying the grazing rabbits. There are two species of English Oak the{Pedunculate}with an acorn cup stalk,and{Sessile}with no acorn cup stalk.There are many hybrids in Sherwood.{Wood Mice}and{Bank Voles} love the acorns and their neglected food-stores result in new trees.Some of the rarest{beetles}in England are found living on the{Fungi}destroying the dying oaks.{Jackdaws,Blue Tits, {Great Tits and Coal Tits}nest in holes in the Oak trees.
